channel.title: prefect on Sarthak Jariwala
channel.description: Recent content in prefect on Sarthak Jariwala

item.title: LocalDaskExecutor : num_workers
item.description: Recently, I was using prefect to run a few workflows locally. I wanted to run one of the workflows in parallel using LocalDaskExecutor. That’s when I learned that LocalDaskExecutor uses num_workers and DaskExecutor uses n_workers to specify the number of workers. With LocalDaskExecutor from prefect.executors import LocalDaskExecutor if __name__ == "__main__": flow.run(executor=LocalDaskExecutor(scheduler="processes", num_workers=16)) With DaskExecutor from prefect.executors import DaskExecutor if __name__ == "__main__": flow.run(executor=DaskExecutor(cluster_kwargs={"n_workers": 16}))
